home.title: Roll for the Galaxy Solo Helper
home.play1: Play Roll for the Galaxy against a Bot with the unofficial Solo Mode by Dale Buonocore and Ken Thibodeau.
home.play2: You can play with the base game, or with all the additional tiles and dice from the expansion Ambition or Rivalry. From the optional modules, only the Objectives module from the Ambition expansion is supported.

general.title: Setup
general.botPlayerMat: Bot only needs a player mat and a credit marker (starting at $1).
general.botNoHomeWorld: Bot does not start with a Home World or Faction tile.
general.botDrawTiles: Bot randomly draws 2 tiles: first, place the lower cost world in his construction zone (you decide which one if equal), then the other tile as a development.

exploreActions.drawTile: Bot draws 1 tile, places it as either a world or development at the bottom of whichever construction zone stack is the shortest. Place tile as a world in case of a tie.

developActions.completeDevelopment: Bot completes the top development if he has enough credits to pay for it.
developActions.notes: Bot spends credits instead of workers. Bot will never benefit from any bonus earned through developments. They will only serve as VPs at game end.

settleActions.completeWorld: Bot completes his topmost world by paying an amount of credits equal to the worldâ€™s value, if he has enough.
settleActions.notes: Bot spends credits instead of workers. Bot will never gain new dice and never benefit from any bonus through worlds. They will only serve as VPs at game end.

produceActions.produceWorlds: Bot produces on his {amount} highest color value available world. | Bot produces on his {amount} highest color value available worlds.
produceActions.notes: Use any die from the supply to serve as the produced good.

shipActions.tradeFirst: Bot first trades the good from the highest color value world for credits (up to the maximum 10$).
shipActions.consumeNext: Bot then consumes the good from the next highest color value world (if available) to gain VPs. If Bot already has $10, he consumes twice.
shipActions.tradeOnly: Bot trades the good from the highest color value world for credits (up to the maximum 10$). If Bot already has $10, he consumes the good from the next highest color value world instead, or any good he has.

gainObjectiveActions.tilesLeft: How many objective tiles are left?
gainObjectiveActions.picksTile: Bot picks tile number {tile} and gains talent counters accordingly.

difficultyLevelExplanation.4: Consume goods for 3/4/5/6 VPs, take 6+ scoring into account

objectiveDifficultyLevel.1: Normal (1 out of {diceRoll} probability to fulfill an objective, max. {maxCount})
objectiveDifficultyLevel.2: Hard (1 out of {diceRoll} probability to fulfill an objective, max. {maxCount})
objectiveDifficultyLevel.3: Insane (1 out of {diceRoll} probability to fulfill an objective, max. {maxCount})

action.abortGameConfirm: Aborting the running game - are you sure?
action.endGameConfirm: End this game and return to home screen - are you sure?

serviceWorkerUpdatedRefresh.title: Refresh Application
serviceWorkerUpdatedRefresh.notice: The application was updated - do you want to refresh to use the latest version?
